Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight stay here with my Mom on a trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona. It was a relatively last minute trip so the hotel was booked last minute and I didn't have time to do a whole lot of research, so thank God for TripAdvisor! Based on the price and the reviews, I decided to book a room here, and am glad I did. Check in and ur was very quick and the staff is great! As others have mentioned, the rooms are not suites, not as I know them at least. They're a little cramped (at least the 2 queen bed rooms are) but if you're not staying in the room too long it's not a big deal, or if you're a solo traveller. They do have a flat screen TV with free HBO, a coffee maker, a small fridge, and a microwave. The bathroom vanity has a marble counter top and a jacuzzi tub, though I didn't stay long enough to try it out. The rooms and the overall hotel were very clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable pillow tops, not too firm and not too plush. There was wi-fi in the room, though I was only able to get it to work once, which really was all I needed. In the lobby there were several computers with Internet access and a printer too, something you don't often see except in more expensive hotels. The pool area was nice though we didn't use it. There's a fitness center, again didn't use it on this short stay, It's small but well equipped. There's a restaurant at the hotel, which we didn't eat at, and also complimentary breakfast in the morning, not just the continental variety either. They had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, cereal, which was all I had time for, pastries, fruit, etc. The cereal was good, and my Mom seemed to enjoy the eggs and sausage, until she found a hair in her scrambled eggs that is. That was the end of breakfast, which was good timing anyway because we had to leave for the airport. We were just here overnight so I can't judge the location relative to anything in Phoenix, honestly I'm not even real sure what part of the city it's in... this is what GPS has done to us, but we can't live without it now can we? Anyway, it's about a 25 minutes to the airport, probably less without traffic. Someone mentioned it's on a busy street, it is, and I did hear the cars for the room but not until the morning almost when we had to get up. I would definitely recommend a stay here if it fits yours needs, it certainly worked for us and exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: mr779419
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located. It is a good value but my first room smelled of smoke. The staff offered to move me to another room and even offered upgrade. The second night of my stay some attempted to break the lock to my room. They didn't get in but when I awoke to go to breakfast the door handle and lock was broken and I was locked out. They eventually fixed the door and lock but offered no compensation for my troubles. The front desk didn't even apologize. Its a nice property but the lack of apology for making me late for my flight home will be the reason I wont use on my next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Suite,but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ozfam51
Reviews.Content: Our room was arranged like a regular hotel room, not a suite, but it still seemed like a pretty good value. It was clean, with nice decor and a comfortable bed. We really loved the complimentary breakfast buffet and the complimentary wine or beer in the afternoon. It was nice to socialize with other guests. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Loved being close to hiking trails.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing suite”
Reviews.Author: ricoswave
Reviews.Content: A suite to me is two rooms. This place is a room with a bathroom in the same room. A closet that is not a closet but just a rack to hang clothes. The only separate room was for the toilet and shower. Not a suite at all but a cheap hotel. Not a good price considering what it was.

Reviews.Title: “it was OK”
Reviews.Author: Freeindeed4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family of four (husband, me, 13 yo, 6 yo) for a 5 day Spring Break get away. Based on the reviews (cleanness and great breakfast) is why I went with it. I'm not super picky in other areas, that's mainly what I look for, BUT BIG MISTAKE for ignoring other "cons" mentioned.... Room: first the room was clean but more like a "remodel" type of clean looks like walls were painted over and you could still see the dirt under the paint. Sinks looked like they didn't use a good cleaner and just wasn't very clean, it was more of a surface clean. A couple of people mentioned it being small. Well it was tiny and hard to even change with privacy. There was no room around the sink, the only door was to the toilet and shower and then to go out. It is way to crammed for a family. The beds were comfortable and they had good selection of towels. I liked that they gave you an option to pick your services everyday. Breakfast: I liked it and I'd say that was very good: homemade waffles, sausage, gravy, biscuits, a lot of toast, eggs, hash browns, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juice-it was excellent but the same everyday and it was a little small and crowded. Staff was very nice and helpful with breakfast. Front desk people were not very helpful but nothing worth complaining about. Not good: the walls were so thin I could literally hear the neighbor "peeing" in his restroom in the very early of the morning, we could here when someone took a shower (water turning on and running) we could also hear all the people outside (talking, walking, driving) plus the windows did not lock. The property was beautiful and the location and pool was pretty great, easy to get around. I gave it a 3 because it wasn't horrible but it was not good enough to come back too.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms adequate, near a busy highway”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: It seems like the rooms are smaller than the sister property in Tucson. The fitness room is not at all good. The equipment is not is good condition and the machines are not clean. The pool is nice, as is the jacuzzi. Staff seem helpful and the majority of the facitily seems to be clean. Breakfast was fine and good selection.

Reviews.Title: “OK suite... let me explain:”
Reviews.Author: Ben0844
Reviews.Content: The good things: Nice staff, helpfull. Clean and quiet place. Nice pool and jacuzzi. Good location. Very good value overall. The "could be better" things: It is a suite with kitchenet that can accomodate up to 6 (!?) persons sleeping... really I would not do more than 4. The 2 queen beds are in the same bedroom so the other couple may have to sleep on the sofabed if you do not wish to share the bedroom (better to know before you go). There is only a small typical hotel room table and 3 chairs, so for eating the meals you have cooked all together can cause a certain logistic problem. The kitchenet is not fully equiped. The kitchen tools are very basic, very small stove, no oven. For pots and pan, ask at the desk because they do not let them in the suite because people steal them. You can do OK with this kitchenet but you better, again, know before you get there with big cooking ideas and be disapointed. We stayed there 2 nights (4 persons) and we appreciated our stay.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected.”
Reviews.Author: B-GEnjoyingLife
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because of Tripadvisor reviews. The price was very reasonable. The room was extremely nice considering the decent price. They have a full hot breakfast which was excellent. They also offer a beer and wine hour each evening although we didn't make it back to the hotel in time most nights.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: marilyn238
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Jan 2012 at this hotel. We had the Junior suite which is a sitting room and separate bedroom. This hotel is nice and clean. They have a free beer and wine happy hour every day at 5:00 and a free barbeque the first Wednesday of the month. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful!. This hotel is situated in Northern Phoenix close to #51 freeway! Excellant location for getting around and in walking distance to some really good restaurants. We would definately stay here again if we are visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking Rooms! Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: OneBadCowboy
Reviews.Content: I try not to ever let just "one thing" be the cause of a bad experience in a hotel. But, when I get stuck in a smoking room....well, that's hard on me! I had asked for non-smoking and they were unfortunately full. They did their best with a room humidifier, but the smell in that room was dreadful. I should have left, but my rate was non-refundable and it had been a long day already..... The staff were reasonable people and they were polite. The room was on the small size - very basic, but acceptable for an overnight accommodation. The morning breakfast was well above average with a good variety of selections. I can't say I would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice value priced establishment in good location!”
Reviews.Author: fourseastravelco1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three days to vacation and visit family in the area. I selected this hotel because we prefer the layout of a suite rather than a typical hotel room. My first impression of the property was very positive, neat, well tended green areas, nice pool,palm trees, tiled walkways and an overall calm atmosphere. We didnt have a day that was warm enough to use the pool, but it looked inviting and clean. Now, my impression of the suite was a bit disappointing, due to how tiny it was. I think they took regular sized hotel rooms and divided them into a sitting room with a bedroom with a door, keeping the bathroom to divide the two areas. It was clean, but we could barely walk around the queen sized bed. A plus was the two flat screen tvs. The breakfast was better than most, with hot entrees, but they were the same choices evey day. Location was good, we had a short ride to the Barrett Jackson auction and casinos. In conclusion,for the price, using BW rewards, and AAA, we got a very good price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic presidential rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Leentje_11
Reviews.Content: We we're looking for a hotel nearby the airport. So we found this Best Western. How lucky we were! Arriving a bit early we got one of the pr. suites. Great rliving room with lazy chairs and a desk and a huge flatscrean. Great spacious bathroom. The bedroom blew us away. Flatscreen very comfy bed and a jaccuzi. It was a great experience to stay yhere. We were lucky becaus at night there was a free bbq. Burgers, sausages and salads. Very nice! Every night there is a happy hour. Breakfast is rich with a lot of choices. The front desk personnel is very friendly. At the end of our trip we stayed again. This time no pr. suite but an executive suite. Very nice also. Overall we highly recommend this BW hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night's Sleep for the Money”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early December. The beds are very comfortable, it was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was happy to see they offered a choice of service for our room to conserve water. The room was a standard size room, but had all the emenities we needed, flat screen TV, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and blow dryer. The shower offered plenty of hot water and the free breakfast bar was delicious. Scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, fresh fruit and Starbuck's coffee. The only downside in my mind was having to use the stairs to get to the second floor where our room was. No elevator made it difficult to haul our bags up the stairs. I would recommend this hotel if you are just looking for a good nights sleep, hot shower and a good breakfast but not if you like to lounge around in your hotel room. It was conveniently located near the 51 interstate which made it great for accessing the entire valley. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Best Western”
Reviews.Author: siyodan
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff were outstanding! Very helpful and friendly. Hotel is located near everything. You get what you pay for at this hotel. It's older but clean and what you would expect for the money. Special thanks to Dan the maint guy. He is an asset to this hotel. And Mr. Quick the general manager who greets all the guest personally. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuru1982
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western Inn and Suuites in Phoenix and though it was an accommodating stay. I was there 5 nights. The staff were friendly, including the young lady working happy hour (free drinks) from Monday to Friday. The breakfast was ok but the most important thing was the shuttle service that dropped us off when we needed it. My room was clean. It had a spa tub (which I never used). It was good to see the general manager walking around talking to people too. The place is kept nice and trim with landscape. My only gripe is that there are only a few things within walking distance. I advise asking about the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaBride
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 room queen suite. The bad first. If you are claustraphobic, don't stay here!! The bedroom was all bed. The closet was 1 1/2 feet wide, behind the door. Sitting area very small with love seat and small desk taking up all of the space. You could hear next door shower loud and clear as if it was in your own bathroom. One bath sink. Now the good. Bed was very comfortable. Two flatscreen TV's. Room was remodeled and very clean. Big shower head. Good air conditioner. Great breakfast. Four computers in lobby with a printer. It is in a great neighborhood and is the eye sore. Very old building. Would not stay here again. We referred to it as a flee bag motel. Front desk, Nina, was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers paradise”
Reviews.Author: LauraSayerG
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet room, comfortable bed, good location. Wireless Internet so-so. Free parking. If you don't smoke and don't want to breath second hand smoke, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaBethlehem
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. Rooms are VERY clean, new and fresh furnishings and carpets, very nice beds with nice linens; thick towels... Nice breakfast incl waffles which we love... AND all of the staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. Loved our desk clerk (weeknights --sorry did not catch her name!), and the very nice breakfast room lady. Only complaint: could use more consistency on soap and occasionally towel delivery. Pool was very nice, hottub a bit too hot. We will definitely stay here again. (lastly: no bedbugs, which is a problem around Phoenix, apparently --we checked before settling in but it is VERY clean!)

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at the Best Western InnSuites...Kim at the front desk very friendly and Reyes in the breakfast room very attentive.We'll be back.Allen & Julie Prescott,Arizona

Reviews.Title: “If you have to be in Phoenix, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsTucsonAZ
Reviews.Content: Being from Tucson, we don't ordinarily stay in Phoenix, but we wanted to get a jump-start on our trip to Yellowstone. We like Best Western, and decided on this one as being just on the "other" side of town convenient for getting away. Hotel easy to find on our GPS; presents a really lovely front. People at the front desk were warm and welcoming. We were upgraded (!) to the Presidential Suite; a really lovely apartment. Two large rooms -- living room and bedroom, and a HUGE bathroom complete with jacuzzi tub. Two large flat-screen TV's; convenient desk with excellent wifi in living room along with couch and loveseat, microwave and fridge. Nicely decorated and contemporary; looked like everything was new. The king-size bed was very comfortable, and the rooms were very quiet and peaceful, making for a very restful night's sleep. Should the occasion arise, we will definitely return to the Phoenix InnSuites.

Reviews.Title: “would definitley come back!”
Reviews.Author: erincolorado
Reviews.Content: Frustration turned to satisfaction! Upon arriving at hotel I was told that my family suite had been given away because of overbooking. They had nothing else available. But they offered us a second room for no charge. I asked if it was an adjoining room and they said there were none in the hotel. I explained I was traveling with kids and wasn't comfortable leaving my kids in a room even though it was next door. Because of the hour there was nothng that could be done. It was very frustrating when I had a confirmation number and everything. I ended up bunking with the girls and my husband bunked with our son. in the light of day I realized that it really wasn't such a bad deal. The rooms were clean, with 2 cloud 9, pillowtop queens. microwave,fridge, free wi - fi, etc. The free breakfast was right next door and very good selection. The front desk carried laundry soap and all kinds of sundries for a very nominal fee. The pool and laundry were literally right outside our door. Very convenient. The best part was, that morning the manager called and said that we were getting an additional discount to make up for the mistake. So we got 4 beds, two bathrooms for 60 bucks a night. My whole bill was only $400 for a whole week....with tax!!!! That was a two hundred dollar discount and we got twice the space. I would definitley recommend this hotel. They keep it clean and there were staff everywhere doing maientnence. Pool area is nice with music and palm trees. very clean. Great for families. check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room & Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sfgiant25
Reviews.Content: Went to Phoenix for a business trip in the middle of the summer. The temperature was triple digits and scorching hot! Check-in was fast and easy and it was relaxing to walk into a cool, air-conditioned room. The Cloud 9 Bed bed that they have is heavenly! There is even an option of buying the same type of bed and have it shipped to you! The in room fridge is a little small, but overall, a very nice, well-kept room. The breakfast is top notch! The breakfast room is roomy with two large HDTV above the breakfast bar area. A great selection of food as well: eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, etc. You could definitely have a hearty breakfast before you start your day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven...”
Reviews.Author: scardicat
Reviews.Content: When you come to beautiful Phoenix Arizona and are looking for a nice place to stay that will provide you with a great nights sleep, great service and lovely location all without breaking the bank...then this is the place for you! After sleeping one night at another property in Phoenix that was a horrible experience I vowed that I would find another hotel that would be to my satisfaction; trust me when I tell you that my expectations of a Best Western stay were far surpassed at the Northern Avenue property. It was easy to find, the front desk personnel were very pleasant and actually glad to have you as a guest! The small suite they put me in was on the second floor away from Northern Avenue traffice and had a refreshing view of the Squaw Peak mountain with an elevation of 2608 feet, which by the way CAN be climbed if you are in for a good hike. If you cannot climb the stairs then stay on the first floor as there is not an elevator, but even tired from lack of sleep the night before I managed a small suitcase, laptop bag and my "jumbo sized" travel purse just fine. As I approached the door of the suite and inserted the key and fippedvon the light I knew I had discovered an economic jewel! The outer sitting area had a nice desk with a halogen lamp for plug in laptops...you heard me a halogen lightbulb! But those of you who are modern techies with WI-FI you just need to sit down on the sofa/sleeper and log in. Unlike the other property who advertised free high speed internet, but could not deliver a connection lasting more than a few minutes, the Best Western delivered true high speed internet and it was consistent the 3 days I stayed! There was also a nice flat screen TV mounted on the wall above the desk AND another one in the bedroom on the wall across from the bed...who would have imagined that somebody actually thought about WHERE a guest would watch tv. There was a small refrigerator and a microwave. The bathroom had a clean shower with good water pressure and hot water throughout my shower and yes, being a girl I like my shower in the morning so it was not a quick one! They give you a nice supply of linens and will change them daily if you wish. The vanity top was a lovely granite and the sink did not back up with water like a lot of them do when you brush your teeth! The sink had nice lighting for make up application or shaving for the gentlemen. The bedroom had the most comfortable mattress and very feather soft pillows as well as a set of firmer ones, so they thought about keeping every guest comfortable. There was a very thoughtful lap tray if you need to sit in bed and work on any writing or computing. There was also a whirlpool tub and though I did not take a soak...let me say that this would have been the first whirlpool that I actually considered getting into! I was impressed with how clean the housekeeping staff kept everything. They also thought of all the little things you might need like a bottle of water AT NO CHARGE, mints in the bedroom and on the refrigerator to welcome you and get this...their . board cover was clean! The place I stayed prior to coming to the Best Western had an ironing board cover that I had to put a towel on before I could press my skirt for a business meeting the next day. As far as the property goes - I got to park right outside my room which was convenient. The lobby has a business center with computers and printers and I know they also have some other equipment such as a copier and fax machine. There is a nice pool area with lounge chairs, and in addition to the pool there is a spa pool. By the pool there is an area of vending machines, coin operated washers and dryers and an ice machine. As far as breakfast..well, yes it was called continental, but I found it to be exception, not because it was INCLUDED, but because it was good. They had 2 kinds of juices, Starbucks coffee, cereal, toast, yogart, 3 hot dishes including scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage and hash browns. Hold onto your hat because after all that for a "continental" breakfast they also had 2 waffle makers so you could cook your own fresh, hot waffle and they even thought about those of us watching our diets because they offered regular and sugar-free syrup! I would highly recommend this property and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Massive rooms, helpful staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussieMum
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights, travelling with two young children. We expected this to be the best place we stayed on our trip and were not disappointed. Slightly faded 80's style, but with gigantic two room suites - we were able to watch TV, update diaries, check emails etc in the lovely sitting room while our children slept in the adjacent bedroom. Luxe decor, two bathrooms (tiny and claustrophobia inducing), serviceable kitchenette if you want it. Beds divinely comfortable - best sleep all holiday. Also a large and well priced laundry, gorgeous pool, great free drinks in dining room at sunset, and the very best buffet breakfasts we had all trip. If you can see past the "Dynasty" decor, you'll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jezzebelmona
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days. The room is comfy and clean with a large TV, many channels and a comfy bed. The one issue we had was breakfast. Yes it's free however it was a mob scene, and the advertisement for Belgian waffles didn't mention you had to cook them yourself! The coffee was very good though and yogurt and fruit. We would stay again just won't do breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnLeduc_Alberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three enjoyable weeks. There are many things that we found very satisfactory about our stay! The staff was exceptionally accommodating. The first thing we noticed was the pleasant and efficient front desk staff -including Mela and the remainder of the reception-area staff. Who could forget the smiling Leo who hosted the afternoon wine and snacks gathering, and who did so many other handyman activities? And then there was the ever-pleasant and efficient Reyl who did a remarkable job of hosting the breakfast which, by the way, was excellent. Cudos to the cleaning staff who cleaned our room admirably well. Another thing we found unusual , but very impressive , was the fact that the manager Mr. Quick spent a great deal of time talking to the guests- an excellent idea! Our room was very nice and spacious and excepionally clean! Perhaps there could be improved lighting. The pool was very clean and the grounds and parking lot were well maintained. The signage identifying the location of the building could be improved. Overall, we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others! Bob and Ellen of Leduc, Alberta , Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap place”
Reviews.Author: Localdj77
Reviews.Content: Super clean, great staff, good breakfast. Waffles that you get to cook, yogurt, cereal. A real breakfast. Close to a lot of fun stuff. Quiet at night too. Worth the money for sure

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: atllisa
Reviews.Content: I thought I was at the wrong hotel when I pulled in. The online photos are deceiving. I was promised a full sized fridge and received a college sized one in the room. The bed was very comfy and the two TV's were a nice touch. The front desk recommends Basha's Supermarket. It is a dingy, over-priced supermarket not far from the hotel. A better suggestion would have been the Fresh & Go Supermarket which is nicer and the food costs less. The free breakfast at the hotel was great if you like a lot of heavy, greasy food. There was eggs, waffles, sausages, gravy, hash browns, cereal, coffee, juice and some apples and grapefruit. The room was very clean except the air vent was very dusty. I placed a 6:00AM wake-up call the morning I was leaving, but I never got it.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is not always what you get - beware of online booking agents!”
Reviews.Author: msluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We went to Phoenix for the evening to insure our family made an early morning flight out. Upon our arrival, after booking an expensive suite, with an online website, we were assigned our room. The room did not match anything advertised online, and even after calling the hotel prior to reserving our room, didn't come close to what we thought we had booked. The first room assigned was very small and dingy with one king sized bed that just fit, and a smaller front room. After about a half hour of going back and forth to the front desk to clarify what an executive king or queen suite was about, we finally found the suite we thought we booked online, and were courtiously moved by the staff. The warning here is buyer beware. While at the front desk, I did overhear the clerk on the phone with the website agent informing them that they had charged us the wrong price for the wrong room. I heard my name mentioned while they were confirming credit card charges, and saw a copy of my confirmation on the desk. This made me question if this website is charging more these days and skimming profits, booking inferior rooms at their customer's cost. When we moved, the room was nice, new clean and spacious. Nothing like the hole in the wall super cheapie room. The customer service was great and accomodating. No complaints on Best Western's end, just the online provider of the rooms. Beautiful pool, beautiful hotel, lovely area, close to the airport. Final bottom line. If you book at this hotel with an online website, bring your confirmation printed out with you, make sure you have the room you booked. I feel we were deceived by this onling website booking agent, which makes me wonder now why American Airlines has dropped them. Best bet is to book directly through this hotel. After checking their prices on their website, it turned out to be even cheaper in the end than the website agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from front desk.”
Reviews.Author: ecthurston
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff made my trip. Definitely will stay here if I'm ever in phoenix again. Wine and beer hour was nice and breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Hands down, Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: siximpossiblethings
Reviews.Content: This was such an awesome hotel! It's been completely renovated & the room were so luxurious! The beds were plush & amazing! Sparkling clean..I checked the sign twice because for a moment I thought I accidentally checked into the nearby resort! Morning brought a wonderful free breakfast with Belgium Waffles, scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, biscuits & gravy, various cereals, toast, fresh fruit, grapefruit and Starbucks coffee! What a suprise! The pool was clean, heated & had a fun fountain. Can't say enough. Was a nice change from he crappier hotels on this trip that I paid twice as much for!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for great price--convenient and clean!”
Reviews.Author: YouMeBean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, and the rooms were everything you'd expect in a higher priced room. In fact, we did stay at a higher price place in Prescott, AZ, and it wasn't nearly as nice as BW. The beds were comfortable and clean. One of the rooms we stayed in was definitely dated, but again, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good, even for an 8 year old. The pool was heated, and there were towels out there, which is better than some places where you have to grab the towels from the room. Overall, a very good deal, in a nice location. I would recommend rooms not facing the pool if you have kids, as people use the pool at night, and there is music playing from the speakers which can be heard inside the rooms if you don't have the A/C going. Ask for ones that face out into the parking lot. Oh, I forgot to check out before running to the airport, and the staff just checked me out over the phone, even though I still had the keys, so customer service was good!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price..clean, quiet, centrally located. Would reccommend!”
Reviews.Author: Breeandfree
Reviews.Content: We were very glad to find a nice pet friendly hotel. We were able to bring our pit bull in without paying an additional fee. All together the room cost $75.00. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they let us look at two rooms when we got there and let us pick which one we wanted. The first room was right next to something for the pool that was really loud so we ended up taking the next room which was nice and quiet. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. You can order room service from a nearby restaurant and the food was very good but overpriced. I will definately stay there again when I go to Phoenix. If you have pets that you travel with this is a great place to go because they keep it clean and it is near a really nice park with hiking trails too.

Reviews.Title: “great central location! great staff that where willing to assist with directions and suggestions for the family”
Reviews.Author: Stuart71
Reviews.Content: Great price. Good breakfast in the morning, would be nice if there was more fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on 2 occasions - it's average at best”
Reviews.Author: redmond_wa_traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient for me. The hotel is okay. It attracts a 'noisy' crowd. There was a fight in the parking lot and the police came - at about 2:00 am. I stayed here twice - the first time - the carpet was very dirty. The 2nd time it was fine. The pool is towards the parking lot. We were swimming at night when one of the guests warned me to stay away from the light - people were shocked by it earlier. They have a decent self-serve breakfast - including waffles, eggs, biscuits and gravy - cereal, etc. During our first stay - we could here the busy road out front. During the 2nd stay - we could here our loud neighbors. There are some good restaurants nearby. I'd look for a discount at the nearby Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably great value”
Reviews.Author: TimberTales
Reviews.Content: Every once in a while, you come across a hotel that completely surprises you. This is one of those hotels. You can't beat the price. In fact, if the hotel cost twice as much, we still would have considered it a great deal. Our room wasn't technically a suite (I'm guessing there are rooms in the hotel that are suites) but it was exceptionally well-appointed with nice furniture, a comfortable king bed, spacious computer desk and flat panel HDTV mounted on the wall in front of the bed. The bathroom featured a fantastic shower head while the sink was located outside the bathroom- always a great thing when you travel with a spouse and you both have to get ready at the same time. Everything was spotlessly clean and appeared to be fairly new- it's possible this hotel was remodeled very recently. Breakfast is included and it's not your typical continental breakfast- the room behind the lobby featured hot foods like bacon and eggs as well as toasters and waffle makers. The rooms surround a nice pool that we didn't have time to enjoy. You can't beat the location- one block from Route 51, which puts you 10 minutes from the airport and very close to many other area attractions. Too bad we only got to enjoy this hotel for one night. It's the kind of hotel we wished we could find everywhere we go. Don't let the low prices scare you away- this is an incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Jefe52
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay in Phoenix for two days on business. The room - a studio with king bed - was top notch. It looked like it had recently bed upgraded. Bed was very comfortable, as were the large pillows. Wifi worked well. The floor in front of the sink is heated, and both regfrigerator and microwave were available. LCD big screen TV. The grounds were quiet and very clean Front desk staff is exceptional, as are the people minding the complementary breakfast and happy hour area. The other employees we met during our stay were extremely courteous and friendly. I will definitely stay here my next trip to Phoenix and have no problems recommending this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit - Always my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Pratt
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to this hotel. I came exactly 1 year ago as well. Just a really class act. Hot tub and Whirlpool are not busy and I like my evening soak with the kids Breakfast is included and served every morning - Always awesome! The front desk people have an amazing attitude - Well done This year they even upgraded my suite at no cost and without asking - Maybe they noticed I have booked in for all 5 days and wanted to say thank you - I don't know. I would rate and recommend this place 100%

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel. 4th stay”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for 2 nights in a king on the first floor facing the pool. Check in was fine. Room had kind of a smoky smell even though it was non-smoking. The 2nd day it was more pronounced after the deodorizer or what ever they used wore off. Bed was comfortable. I could not get the aircon/fan to work even though I used their instructions on the bedside table. Temperature was not bad so I did not complain. Toilet would run occasionally. Fridges are turned off at check in so plan accordingly if you bring perishables at check in. I could not get the wired internet to work but I could get in with the wireless but you would have to log back in every so often. There is noise and light that comes in under the door. They are not very generous with the towels. 2 bath, 2 hand, and 2 wash cloths. If I had an extra towel I would have put it at the base of the door. The breakfast is still the same and there is plenty of it. If they are having a meeting on site the breakfast room gets halved so seats can be scarce. All in all this hotel is a great value so we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly the only thing good here was the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Kahne
Reviews.Content: Smoking/hangout patio was in front of room. People sitting there getting drunk till 1-2am. Called to get a car sent to airport for pick up. wasn't there. called to find out where it was front desk didn't know what I was talking about and told me to take a cab. Pillows were lumpy, bed hard. Had to go to chiropractor when I got home. Spend a few more dollars and stay somewhere else. It was Nascar weekend and everywhere was SUPER expensive or I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: decaugnanny
Reviews.Content: great hotel, clean with lots of hot water and a bed you could stay in for a week

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshquin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night having flown in to Phoenix from London. Our room was a little "tired" but it was very comfortable and clean. The hot breakfast didn't look appetising so opted for just toast, juice and coffee, which was fine. Overall, a great value hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calkatt
Reviews.Content: We were in Phoenix for a medical procedure and this hotel was recommended by our doctor's office. What a great surprise when we drove in - a beautiful hotel that looked like a mini-resort. Great pool area, laundry, hot tub and super-comfy beds and pillows in quiet and comfortable rooms with all amenties. Best of all, a friendly and accomodating staff and a delicious hot breakfast . HIghly recommend this hotel, it's location is excellent and we felt right at home. Kathy in Spokane, WA

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but not all suites”
Reviews.Author: SoFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay. The hotel is located in a nice residential area of North Phoenix, just up 16th street from the Point Hilton Resort. It is about a one minute drive from the 51 Expressway and 10 minutes from I-17. The airport is an easy 15-20 minute drive straight up the 51 Expressway. The hotel is in the final stages of refurnishing. Although all the rooms are named suites, my room was a refurbished motel sized standard room. The bed was very comfortable with nice linen and a choice of pillows. The very small bathroom has been modernized, and the sink with a new granite counter is in the room itself. There is a small fridge, microwave, and individual coffee/tea maker sharing the counter. There is a small area to hang clothing, a modern 32" flatscreen TV, and a simple formica desk and chest. The wifi worked well--but I could never connect to the internet using my ethernet cable. The AC was not as noisy as it was annoying as it blew directly onto the bed. I moved a small table over to deflect the breeze. There was only a recliner in my room---no sofa. Breakfast was good although the same menu is served daily: waffles, scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausages,breads, biscuits with gravy and a selection of 3 cereals and some fruit. The ladies in the dining room were very friendly. I didn't attend the afternoon cocktail get-togethers. The printer in the lobby was not working, but the staff allowed me to print out my boarding pass on their printer. There are four public guest computers. My only complaint, other then my disappointment over the room size, was that a noisy group of guests stayed in the pool until I called the front desk at 2:30AM. Apparently the pool should have closed at 10PM, and the guests left after the clerk spoke with them, but this indicates that no one did a security walk about the property during those hours. In summary, I had a nice stay at this hotel and would visit again, as I had a geat rate. If you really want a two room suite---ask for it and be prepared to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “A standout value”
Reviews.Author: thewildboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We had reservations (paid for my family) at a much more expensive restaurant downtown for the remainder of our trip and wanted something affordable for our first night in town so we chose the Best Western based on the reviews here. We were very pleased with our stay and in fact wished we could have stayed there after a disappointing stay at the "fancy" hotel that cost 4x as much! The property was well maintained and located close to the highway. Our room was as requested ( a king bed on the second floor) and clean. The facilities included parking, a pool, hot tub, fitness center, business center with four (!) computers and a printer, and a hot and cold breakfast buffet. All was included in the unbelievably low price of our night's stay. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for this class of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy3k
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Phoenix and first stay at a Best Western. I usually stay at Hilton brands (e.g., Hampton or Homewood). I travel a lot for business, but never this far from home with short notice and no choice of where to stay! The hotel was really nice! the rooms are spacious and have been updated recently. i had a regular King "Inn Suite" which is a King room with a mini-fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. The vanity and tub/toilet areas are separate, which would be nice if traveling with family. The bed was extremely comfortable, and I'm hard to please in that department because I sleep on a "sleep number" bed at home. The room was always cleaned impeccably and I never noticed any disrepair with anything in or outside my room. Had only a little staff interaction because of long work hours, but they all seemed nice. The free breakfast had hot and cold items and included a waffle maker. We did not get to experience it, but they do have a nightly food/drink reception also. Internet connectivity was good (wireless or cord). I had a room facing the pool, which looked nice (maybe a bit smallish), and had a hot tub too. I didn't get to use these, so can't say any more. There was a lot of noise from the front door area with people using the pool and my room was next to the stairs. If noise bothers you, ask for a room in the back. Other than that, the rooms are really well sound-proofed. I hardly ever heard anything from above or the rooms beside me (like through the walls/ceiling). The hotel was full due to the basketball tournaments, but you never would have known. Location was OK from what I could tell. It was about a 15 minute ride from the airport in no traffic to about a 25 minute ride in morning rush hour to the airport. The closest restaurant is a 2 minute drive/15 minute walk up the road. There are stores and gas stations just a bit further (not walking distance, but maybe 5 minutes by car, at most). I would definitely stay there again. No worries!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jfish94
Reviews.Content: I was here for business for a couple of nights. I really enjoyed this hotel and it's staff. The location was perfect for me. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable value for the price! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: We'reouttahere
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our three night stay at this property. We LOVED it! Travelling on a budget is always a little tricky - you are never quite sure what you are going to get. Based on the reviews on this site, we felt fairly confident that we would be satisfied, and we were. We booked this hotel through an online discount travel site for the price of $77.00 per night (Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights). We opted to take a taxi from Phoenix Sky Harbor airport to the hotel - the cost with tip was a little over $30.00. We should note that our friends were staying in Scottsdale, and we were about a 20 minute car ride from eachother. We arrived around 10:00 p.m Friday night. The girl at the front desk was friendly, helpful and efficient - we were in our room in no time. The room was GREAT! (We were in Room #138). A couch to the left when you walk in, a desk with computer chair and computer hook up to the right. A brand new looking, sparkling clean refrigerator, microwave, FREE bottled water and large flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom sink was outside the bathroom itself, which I love - it was very tasteful, with what appeared to be granite counter top. The bathroom was spotlessly clean with tiled floor and walls. The shower has a curved rod, which not only looks classy, but it gives you extra room in the shower. The towels were clean, generously sized and fluffy. The hotel also supplied Bath & Body lotion, shampoo, soap and conditioner. There was also a sign on the bathroom sink that if you had forgotten some basic ammenities (comb, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc.), the hotel would supply them for you for FREE. The biggest surprise was the bedroom, which was seperated from the other areas by a door. We had a queen sized bed (really nice linens, with soft, fluffy (down?) pillows, and tasteful spread), a TV, two nightstands (one had an Ipod Home base, so you can play your tunes in your room), and also a TWO PERSON jaucuzzi tub, surrounded by beautiful tile work -- RIGHT IN THE ROOM! Yes!!!! All this for $77.00!!!???? We checked out the "gym". It is small. We work out at a gym regularly, and both of us felt that this little space offered everything you would need for a quick little work out - they had a few cardio pieces, some free-weights and some machines. Nothing fancy, but if you need to burn some calories, you could get it done. We did not use the heated pool or outdoor hot tub, but we did look at them - they appeared clean, with plenty of lounge chairs (with folded towels supplied on the back of each) and even a little patio type sitting area, which I believe had tables with umbrellas for shade. We took advantage of the FREE ice - as we had a cooler with us, and needed to keep refilling. It is in it's own area (you need your room card-key to access) and this room also has laundry facilities (not sure if they are free or not) and a few vending machines. Again, it was spotlessly clean. We took advantage of the FREE hot-buffet breakfast every morning. We thought it was great. They had 4 different types of cold cereal, and offered 2% and whole milk. Coffee, tea, orange juice and cranberry juice were also available. There was also packets of oatmeal, fresh fruit (apples and bananas), and yogurt. There was a make-your-own waffle station (two waffle makers) with pre-made batter for you to use, scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, bisquits with gravy (new to us Northerners!) and about 4 different types of bread with jelly and butter available, and a toaster to use. This was such a nice ammentity for us...not only did we not have to pay for a hot, filling breakfast, but we didn't need to venture out to find something either. This hotel also offers a FREE Happy Hour, which unfortunately, we were unable to take advantage of! You get two FREE drinks, and FREE appetizers - I don't recall the hours it is offered, but we never made it back to the hotel in time. There are also two large grills outside near the pool, for guests to use for FREE. You can borrow the utensils from the front desk, and we noticed a sign near the grills that said that the first Wednesday of every month the staff offeres a FREE barbeque for all the guests. The lobby to this hotel is really nice as well. There is a gas fireplace, a small area where coffee is available throughout the day, as well as chocolate chip cookies, nice couches and chairs, mailbox, and also about 5 computers for you to use...again, for FREE. There is a laser printer as well - no charge for that either. The staff at this hotel could not have been nicer. We called the front desk one evening to see if they had information on pizza delivery - they gave us three phone numbers (local calls are free). We called another morning because we needed a taxi, they took care of that for us. We called the front desk at 12:30 at night because our bedroom smoke detector was beeping, and they got right on that. And, when our phone mysteriously stopped working for local calls, the maintenance man came right over. He was professional and friendly. Another thing that we loved about his property was their effort for going "green". They had a sign in the bathroom that stated if you didn't need your towels changed, to just hang them on the rack. Also, they will only change your sheets once every three days. They also made a suggestion about how to leave your airconditioning when not in the room. We love this! For the price of this hotel, the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, the clean, modern accomodations, and everything that is included with it, you CANNOT BEAT THIS HOTEL. We would stay here again, and would highly recommend it to just about anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Travelwise67
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed there the day we flew in and then the night before we flew out. It was close to the airport. The hotel staff was very friendly, the rooms were very clean, both times. The rooms were quiet. The pool was great and quiet both times, loved the lighted palm trees at night. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable, everything you could imagine and a wonderful lady taking care of it. The 2nd night we stayed there we had a king jacuzzi suite. Awesome suite, 2 bathrooms, sinks and showers seperated by french doors. Also 2 flat sceen tvs and lots of space in each room. The only complaint I had is that our suite smelled like smoke and it was a non smoking suite. We turned on both air conditioners to get rid of the smell and it wouldn't go away. I would highly recommend the hotel, great location, great service, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdcliff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February 2008 for three nights. It was centrally located for the business and restaurants we frequented while attending a conference; however it was not as nice as the pictures lead you to believe. The Pool area is nice, but what hotel in Phoenix doesn't have a nice pool? All the doors for each room are on the outside, and that leads to high noise levels, especially since the hotel sits at a busy intersection. Our particular room sat right on the road, and it was noisy ALL NIGHT! The staff was nice, and allowed us to hang out in the breakfast eating area most of the night playing some no-money poker. I'd rather pay a little more money, and stay somewhere less noisy next time I travel to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Two nights - $40 difference in price”
Reviews.Author: tripjimbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, at the beginning and end of our trip to Arizona. Despite booking the hotel on-line well in advance I got two different rates $116 for the first night, $152 for the second + tax. I'd say that the first rate is closer to the real value of the room - we debated looking for another less expensive hotel for the last night and canceling the second reservation but didn't want to go through the hassle, especially since we were traveling with a baby. What you get for your money - convenient location close to I51 but not close enough to hear the traffic. Easy 30 minute drive to the airport or car rental drop off. Good quality, clean rooms, comfortable beds, excellent breakfast (already described in detail in other reviews). Good area. We were upgraded on our first night to a two room suite (because they were overbooked) which came equipped with two washrooms (one wheelchair accessible), flat screen tvs, fold out couch bed. Very nicely done. Only complaint would be that the view was the stairwell heading up to the second floor and several mattresses that were being stored(?) there. On our second night we had a standard room with a single king bed - also very nice (but not worth the extra $40 we paid). We overlooked the pool and the jacuzzi was running all night. Front desk staff were very helpful and had good recommendations for restaurants -you're within walking distance (about 1 mile) from several restaurants - try Carlos O'Brien's. A crib was requested and a playard was provided - mattress too hard for a baby to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “doubtful for another visit”
Reviews.Author: trippingJack
Reviews.Content: Start with the positives: Housekeeping service was first-rate and the hotel location is convenient. The king non-smoking room had a comfortable bed and a plasma-TV and couch for $150/single. The room had both refrigerator/microwave. Shower and bathtub were better than average. Continuing with the negatives: no morning newspaper at your door - in fact usually no newspaper on the premises in the late morning, at all. Breakfast room small and usually crowded with no pastries - had to settle for banana/yogurt. Coffeemaker in room was the one-cup-only variety rather than the usual (4-cup) pot. Location of hotel is intersection of two (Northern & 16th Street) heavily traveled and noisy roads - ask for a room facing the back of the property. Request for a third bath towel daily was ignored. Registration staff was uninterested. Bottomline: aside from proximity to a convenient freeway, this facility has little to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: nashuanh5
Reviews.Content: Needed a place before we flew home. Close to the airport and restaurants. Breakfast was "healthy" (limited) and the free reception was a nice touch. Pool towels were skimpy, but big deal, take two. Nice desk folks. What we expected.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Price...15 Minutes to Airport”
Reviews.Author: azahunting
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel...but really short on towels. The pool towels are like face clothes and more than a little tired. The room was nice and tidy, but keep your shoes on. The carpets are a little dirty. Nice happy hour and not bad breakfast. Hot tub air jets broken pool jets broken but both clean. The area was nice and SAFE for out-of-towners.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this place”
Reviews.Author: CindyDeerfieldMA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Phoenix where we had stayed at this hotel for four nights. Normally we stay at Hampton Inns but wanted to be in the Squaw Peak area and thus decided to stay here. Right from check-in we should have known what to expect. We arrived too early to check in but since we travel very often we knew it was possible to leave your baggage there until check-in. While initially the staff was rude, the gentleman FINALLY agreed to have us leave our luggage and said it would be in our rooms when we checked back in later. Of course it was NOT in the room and we were on the second floor and no elevator! We are in our 60s and this was NOT convenient for either my husband or me. Breakfast is boring with the same thing every day, not like Hampton Inns that vary the menu. The air conditioning did not function well, the water in the tub did not drain out so that when taking a shower you were up to your knees in water. When we arrived and I asked where one could go to check on e-mails, as had been advertised in their listing service available in the Business Center, they told me it was "down" and not expected to be up until Monday.........this was Sat. On Monday when I checked again I was told still not up until Tuesday. One couple standing at the desk when I asked that question and heard this, turned on their heal and left as this was a businessman who needed that service. VERY inconvenient. Still not up when we left on Wednesday. Maintenance is terrible......lot of evidence that the place has been "let go". Breakfast area is very small..........as is the pool.......and with a tendency to cater to kids' traveling sports teams, you are lucky to find a spot to sit. This is the second time we have encountered this with a Best Western and will never stay at one again. Hampton Inns much better. Skip this place.........

Reviews.Title: “Good motel, Poor location”
Reviews.Author: Benbimi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. My overall sense is that this was a good motel, comparatively inexpensive. Pros: - Comparatively inexpensive - Microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker in room - Decent (but repetitive) breakfast included in price (wafles, scrambled eggs, cereal, etc.) - Free internet access (including printing) from lobby - Nice staff Cons: - Average room size. - Very limited space to hang clothes My biggest problem was the location. It was far away from all the sites I wanted to see. M.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: glbtrttr
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in a wide range of hotels - 2 star to 5 star so generally I have my expectations managed. This BW was actually a little above expectations; part of that might have to do with the fact that we arrived fairly early to check in - around noon - and they had a room ready and "upgraded" us to a suite on the 7th floor. Now, it was a suite at a Best Western, but still nice to have the extra space. Convenient to downtown although with the light rail construction that's going on in and around the city, need to plan a little extra time. Plenty of extra parking although none of it is covered, so don't leave anything in your car if you're there over the summer or it will be cooked! Definitely also recommend the restaurant ZEN which is a couple miles north on Central Ave and recently opened. Fitness center is a bit of a joke, but the pool, although small, was clean and had ample seating (lounge chairs and tables).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shouldercat
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated rooms are above average -especially when you consider the price! Beds are very comfy with pillowtop mattresses. Complimentary breakfast includes eggs and hashbrowns, cereals, and toast/bagels. Laundry facilities make this a great choice for extended stays. Nearby Dreamy Draw Park and Aunt Chilada's restaurant are bonuses. Great choice for the frugal traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: skagit46
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy resort, but it has all the aces and for less than 100 bucks during season, it's an excellent value. Beds very comfortable, free internet, attentive staff, nice breakfast and little extras.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: moonkwean
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 days in Phoenix but only three nights at this hotel. Wished we had booked our whole stay here. Staff very friendly and available. Any time we requested something it was attended to right away. Rooms clean. Bonus is the breakfast, social time and the 3 computers in the lobby. Would definately stay here again. Thanks David, Pamela and Mila.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: cridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn Suites beginning of May. We were looking for a budget hotel and I got an awesome deal on the Best Western site. (49.00 a night) Good points: room was clean and comfortable what you would expect. NOTE: We traveled with a 2 year old and there was NO room for a crib/ playpen with the two queen beds. This proved problematic as she was in/out of bed!!! Therefore keep this in mind before you order two queens! GOOD: Free breakfast in AM - "You make waffles" yummy, lots of juice, cereal, and other goodies. Unfortunately the breakfast room was small and often cramped, as well you may have to wait for your turn at the waffle cooker. GOOD: Staff where polite and offered travel tips. GOOD: First Wed of month they have a free BBQ (Hamburgers) looked OK but we skipped it. NOT SO GOOD: Pool was not the cleanest - scum around edge of pool. Hot tub either bath tub temp. or too hot? Also pool is located around the parking lot...therefore not the most relaxing, private or scenic. NOT SO GOOD: no place to sit outside room. There is a little deck, and pool area but we had to stay close to our room when our daughter was sleeping. We sat on cement railing and were in the way of cleaning staff. ADVICE: If you are traveling with kids, especially young ones - stay at a resort with LOTS OF AMENITIES! You do not want to be putting kids in/out of hot cars trying to find a place to eat or an activity to do. NOT RELAXING! ALSO: Avoid Tempe Town lake - not much there! Water park at Zoo fun choice! Lots of shade! AVOID AT ALL COSTS: Forgot the name but it is a "Cowboy" steakhouse in the hills of Phoenix. They cut off ties and hang them from ceiling?TERRIBLE - $50 meal - Poor steak - with potato chips, store bought bread and one bowl of beans to share???? Would I go back to Phoenix? Yes, with my husband (maybe with an older more independant child that could play at pool by herself) and A LOT of $$. To enjoy Shopping which is very very ritz and to have spa treatment ect.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were not parking lot available for hotel guests. The hotel should have informed us that they are having construction work done on the premise. The construction work permitted us to find parking spaces. The construction noises started by 6:30 in the morning. Both phones in the hotel room do not work. The carpet looks dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LEckman
Reviews.Content: It's not deluxe accomodations, but it's just fine. I've stayed in 3 star hotels that were worse. The thing I liked is that it had all the amenities I wanted: High speed internet access in your room at no cost, free breakfast (and a very good one - not just the typical "continental"), fax service (n/c), nice pool and spa, good location. And two drinks (beer, wine, soda) every afternoon - again n/c. The bed was great. Quiet. M/W and fridge in the room. For the price, it's a great deal. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but expected better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the look of the hotel on various websites, I expected a nice hotel with suites (hence the name). However, our room was a normal hotel room with a microwave in it. Not what I expected for what I paid. The breakfast was a nice addition and the rooms were clean. I would imagine that the pool and barbeque area are very nice in good weather.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS InnSuites Phoenix Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1615 East Northern Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85020
